intro: Conostylis villosa, commonly known as the silky everlasting, is a perennial herb native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy, pinkish-red flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands, often in well-drained soils. Its fibrous roots and compact growth habit make it adaptable to various environmental conditions. Conostylis villosa is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
